definition: to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Animato Music Studio is a music education centre established by a group of education workers and musicians.
sentences.chinese: 是一个由教育工作者及音乐家创办的音乐传艺中心。

sentences.english: History of non-text-based resources should be included in the historical perspective of educators.
sentences.chinese: 非文字化的历史资源应纳入历史教育工作者的视野。

sentences.english: Another is to become an educator or a social worker.
sentences.chinese: 另一个条出路就是成为教育工作者或社会工作者。

sentences.english: Two veteran communication educators, Prof. Timothy Yu and Mr. Raymond R. Wong are named "Pioneers in Communication Education".
sentences.chinese: 奖颁予资深传理教育工作者余也鲁教授和黄应士先生。

sentences.english: That’s one way out. Another is to become an educator or a social worker.
sentences.chinese: 另一个条出路就是成为教育工作者或社会工作者。

sentences.english: Experienced family education consultant and author Shirley nulloo.
sentences.chinese: 资深家庭教育工作者及作家罗乃萱。

sentences.english: People in the field of education worked especially hard.
sentences.chinese: 特别是教育工作者，他们的劳动更辛苦。

definition: preschool education/abbr. for 幼兒教育|幼儿教育[you4 er2 jiao4 yu4]
all-round education (contrasted with 應試教育|应试教育[ying4 shi4 jiao4 yu4], exam-oriented education)
English Language Teaching (ELT)/studying and teaching English
head of a household/family head/patriarch/parent or guardian of a child
